page.title: 10Hoddlesden Village
page.content: Hoddlesden is a small village nestling between the hills of Pickup Bank and Hoddlesden Moss.The village originally developed because of the local coal and clay pits.Then the textile industry developed here because of the favourable conditions.Both these industries brought work into Hoddlesden.Now all the mining has gone but new housing development has increased and people have come to Hoddlesden not,as in the past,to work but purely to live.The old part of the village is situated in the centre,around Queen's Square.The new housing development began in the 1960's and has only recently been completed.The village is surrounded by farm land,mostly rough pasture which is used for dairy cattle.There are only limited facilities in the village so most people travel into Darwen.
